name: Intel BootGuard: Policy
description: BootGuard is a processor feature that prevents the machine from running firmware images not released by the system manufacturer.
It forms a root-of-trust by fusing in cryptographic keys into the processor itself that are used to verify the Authenticated Code Modules found in the SPI flash.
failure-impact: The attacker can invalidate the chain of trust (subverting Secure Boot), and the user would get just a console warning and then continue to boot.

success-results.valid: error enforce policy is set to shutdown
